title: Approximate Architecture Gradient
body:
I have few questions on the [section : Approximate Architecture Gradient in the paper](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1806.09055.pdf#page=4)

1. Why Evaluating the finite difference requires only _two forward passes_ for the weights and _two backward passes_ for α, and the complexity is reduced from `O(|α||w|)` to `O(|α|+|w|)`  ?
2. Looking at equation 7, we have a second-order partial derivative which is computationally expensive to compute. To solve this, the finite difference method is used.  <-- how is second-order partial derivative related to [finite difference method](https://mythrex.github.io/math_behind_darts/) ?
3. We also note that when momentum is enabled for weight optimisation, the one-step unrolled learning objective in equation 6 is modiﬁed accordingly and all of our analysis still applies. <--  How is momentum directly related to the need of applying chain rule to equation 6 ?
